sen.j: 小梁川 盛宗（こやながわ もりむね）
sen.e: Morimune KOYANAGAWA
Morimune KOYANAGAWA

sen.j: 室町時代の人物。
sen.e: A person in the Muromachi period.
A person in the Muromachi period.
A person in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の人物。
sen.e: A person in the Sengoku period (of Japan).
A person in the Sengoku period (of Japan).
A person in the Sengoku period (of Japan).

sen.j: 小梁川盛宗（こやながわ もりむね、生没年不詳）は室町時代の人物。
sen.e: Morimune KOYANAGAWA (years of birth and death unknown) was a historic figure in the Muromachi period.
Morimune KOYANAGAWA (years of birth and death unknown) was a historic figure in the Muromachi period.
Morimune KOYANAGAWA (years of birth and death unknown) was a historic figure in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 陸奥国小梁川氏の祖。
sen.e: He was the progenitor of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.
He was the progenitor of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.
He was the progenitor of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 伊達持宗の子。
sen.e: He was the son of Mochimune DATE.
He was the son of Mochimune DATE.
He was the son of Mochimune DATE.

sen.j: 中務大輔。
sen.e: He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.
He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.
He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.

sen.j: 小梁川親朝、小梁川宗朝の父。
sen.e: He was the father of Chikatomo and Munetomo KOYANAGAWA.
He was the father of Chikatomo and Munetomo KOYANAGAWA.
He was the father of Chikatomo and Munetomo KOYANAGAWA.

sen.j: 伊達郡の小梁川の地に分家し、小梁川氏を興した。
sen.e: He set up a branch family in Koyanagawa, Date-gun to establish the Koyanagawa clan.
He set up a branch family in Koyanagawa, Date-gun to establish the Koyanagawa clan.
He set up a branch family in Koyanagawa, Date-gun to establish the Koyanagawa clan.

sen.j: 下記の盛宗は曾孫である。
sen.e: Morimune described below was his great-grandson.
Morimune described below was his great-grandson.
Morimune described below was his great-grandson.

sen.j: 小梁川 盛宗（こやながわ もりむね、大永3年（1523年）- 文禄4年1月14日 (旧暦)（1595年2月22日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の人物。
sen.e: Morimune KOYANAGAWA (1523 - February 22, 1595) was a historic figure in the Sengoku period (of Japan).
Morimune KOYANAGAWA (1523 - February 22, 1595) was a historic figure in the Sengoku period (of Japan).
Morimune KOYANAGAWA (1523 - February 22, 1595) was a historic figure in the Sengoku period (of Japan).

sen.j: 陸奥国小梁川氏当主。
sen.e: He was lord of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.
He was lord of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.
He was lord of the Koyanagawa clan in Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 伊達氏家臣。
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Date clan.
He was a retainer of the Date clan.
He was a retainer of the Date clan.

sen.j: 伊達晴宗の娘婿。
sen.e: He was Harumune DATE's adopted son-in-law.
He was Harumune DATE's adopted son-in-law.
He was Harumune DATE's adopted son-in-law.

sen.j: 小梁川親宗（尾張守）の子。
sen.e: He was the son of Chikamune KOYANAGAWA (Owari no Kami).
He was the son of Chikamune KOYANAGAWA (Owari no Kami).
He was the son of Chikamune KOYANAGAWA (Owari no Kami).

sen.j: 小梁川宗重の父。
sen.e: He was the father of Muneshige KOYANAGAWA.
He was the father of Muneshige KOYANAGAWA.
He was the father of Muneshige KOYANAGAWA.

sen.j: 中務大輔。
sen.e: He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.
He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.
He was Nakatsukasa no Taifu.

sen.j: 小梁川親朝系の人物であり、上記の盛宗は曽祖父にあたる。
sen.e: He was descended from Chikatomo KOYANAGAWA and Munemori mentioned above was his great-grandfather.
He was descended from Chikatomo KOYANAGAWA and Munemori mentioned above was his great-grandfather.
He was descended from Chikatomo KOYANAGAWA and Munemori mentioned above was his great-grandfather.

sen.j: 伊達晴宗の代から伊達氏に仕え、出羽国置賜郡の高畠城を与えられていた。
sen.e: Having been a retainer of the Date clan since the time of Harumune DATE, he was given Takahata Castle in Okitama-gun, Dewa Province.
Having been a retainer of the Date clan since the time of Harumune DATE, he was given Takahata Castle in Okitama-gun, Dewa Province.
Having been a retainer of the Date clan since the time of Harumune DATE, he was given Takahata Castle in Okitama-gun, Dewa Province.

sen.j: 智勇に優れた人物。
sen.e: He was a wise and courageous man.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was a wise and courageous man.
He was a wise and courageous man.

sen.j: 最上氏の武将・里見民部との戦いや大内定綱との戦いで武功を挙げた。
sen.e: He achieved military success in combat with Minbu SATOMI who was a busho (military commander) of the Mogami clan and with Sadatsuna OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He achieved military success in combat with Minbu SATOMI who was a busho (military commander) of the Mogami clan and with Sadatsuna OUCHI.
He achieved military success in combat with Minbu SATOMI who was a busho (military commander) of the Mogami clan and with Sadatsuna OUCHI.

sen.j: しかし1570年に中野宗時が出奔したときは、これを見逃したために輝宗の怒りを買った。
sen.e: In 1570, however, he aroused Terumune's anger when he failed to capture Munetoki NAKANO who escaped.
In 1570, however, he aroused Terumune's anger when he failed to capture Munetoki NAKANO who escaped.
In 1570, however, he aroused Terumune's anger when he failed to capture Munetoki NAKANO who escaped.

sen.j: 1585年に伊達輝宗が死去すると、老齢を理由に一線から退いて隠居した。
sen.e: He retired from active duties on account of old age when Terumune DATE died in 1585.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He retired from active duties on account of old age when Terumune DATE died in 1585.
He retired from active duties on account of old age when Terumune DATE died in 1585.

sen.j: 以後は伊達政宗の側近として政宗に助言したと言われている。
sen.e: He had since given advice to Masamune DATE as the latter's close associate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had since given advice to Masamune DATE as the latter's close associate.
He had since given advice to Masamune DATE as the latter's close associate.

sen.j: 晩年は泥播斎と号した。
sen.e: In his later years he was known as Deibansai.
In his later years he was known as Deibansai.
In his later years he was known as Deibansai.

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）正月14日、京都で死去した。
sen.e: On February 22, 1595 he died in Kyoto.
On February 22, 1595 he died in Kyoto.
On February 22, 1595 he died in Kyoto.

sen.j: 享年73。
sen.e: He was 73 years old.
He was 73 years old.
He was 73 years old.
